title: Splunk, Blackstone, Nio, Affirm, Lockheed: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today; Cisco made a takeover offer for Splunk; Lockheed Martin scrapped an acquisition plan
text:
* Crown Resorts, one of Australia's biggest casino operators, said Monday that it agreed to a $6.3 billion takeover by Blackstone, following a roughly yearlong effort by the U.S. private-equity giant to acquire the company.

* Needham and Raymond James both trimmed their price targets for Avalara shares, but also kept their ratings of "buy" and "outperform" in place.

* The FDA on Friday authorized the use of a new Covid-19 antibody drug from Eli Lilly that retains effectiveness against the Omicron variant of the virus.

* Lockheed Martin on Sunday said it had scrapped plans to buy Aerojet Rocketdyne Holdings after federal antitrust overseers last month sued to block the proposed $4.4 billion deal.

* Shares of Affirm Holdings were wavering in morning trading. The buy-now-pay-later company's stock has closed down more than 20% in both of the past two sessions.

* Wedbush lifted its rating on Micron Technology to "outperform" and raised its price target for the stock to $120 from $100.

* Avis Budget, Advance Auto Parts and Arista Networks are among the companies reporting earnings Monday.

Chart of the Day

* A turbulent start of the year for U.S. stocks has entered a new phase in recent days, with investors weighing good news about corporate earnings and the labor market against the stubborn challenges of high inflation, rising bond yields and geopolitical uncertainty.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com

Splunk, Blackstone, Nio, Affirm, Lockheed: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today
